<tr>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;vertical-align: top" valign="top">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: separate" width="100%">
<tr>
<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong>A few years ago I met a journalist who worked in dangerous areas of Somalia. Despite us both being in the “news” industry, I remember thinking to myself, “Well, we have <em>very</em> different jobs.” </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">This morning you’ll be waking up to headlines (not in Sunday Edition) of the Taliban having entered Afghanistan’s capital city of Kabul. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">My thoughts go back to that reporter, who recently joined the Kabul bureau, and all the other journalists in the area who are bravely keeping us informed—especially the local ones for whom this must be particularly devastating.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">As one Afghan reporter wrote, “Being an Afghan journalist in Afghanistan is like writing a story about different fires in your house and report the burning of each part, despite your family members being stuck there and you can’t help them.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal Freyman</p>
</div>

</tr>

</tr>

</td>
</tr>

<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Stock Watch: 'Jeopardy!'
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">We didn’t have space to include it in the chart, but here’s a great factoid: Media mogul Merv Griffin originally composed <em data-stringify-type="italic">Jeopardy!</em>’s iconic theme song, “Think!”, as a lullaby for his son. In 2005, he told the NYT that it made him between $70–$80 million in royalties.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjQwL2plb3BhcmR5X3N0b2NrX3dhdGNoLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Jeopardy stock watch" data-source="" data-reactroot=""></p>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"> </p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;color: #353535; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 22px; table-layout: auto; width: 100%; border: none;" width="100%">
<tr>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
Q&A
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers with...Olympic Champion Surfer Carissa Moore
</h1>
<img alt="TOKYO, JAPAN - JULY 24: Carissa Moore of Team United States poses ahead ..." style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjMzL2Fyb3VuZF90aGVfZ2FtZXNfLV9vbHltcGkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Ryan Pierse/Getty Images</em>
</small>
</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In Tokyo, Hawaii native Carissa Moore won the gold medal for the US in surfing’s first ever Olympics. Not satisfied with that hardware, Carissa is currently competing in the World Surf League’s latest event in Oaxaca, Mexico, where she’s already notched a near-perfect 9.80 on one wave.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">What’s the world of competitive surfing like? Here’s Carissa in her own words.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>How do you think surfing’s introduction to the Olympics will affect the sport?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I hope it opens up surfing to a broader audience and can bring more people in, whether that's by inspiring someone to try surfing for the first time, or motivating them to choose their own path.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>As an athlete who’s been vocal about your mental health, how have you felt seeing Naomi Osaka and Simone Biles put a spotlight on mental health this year?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I think we all, every human, go through our own mental struggles. I feel that as athletes, sometimes it can be amplified with the pressure of the events and being under a microscope. But being conscious of and in tune with your own mental health, not being afraid to ask for help, and taking the time you need to feel through that space is super important.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What is the community of pro surfer women like?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s a really small, tight community. I feel like everybody knows everybody for the most part, and it’s like a second family to me. I've grown up with a lot of the women on tour, and there’s mutual respect among all of us. But also we want to beat each other really bad, you know?</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>If you could compete at any surf spot in the world, where would it be?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Oaxaca is definitely one of the places that I'm the most excited to compete at. I’ve been on a surf trip here but it was over 10 years ago, and I have some of the best memories from surfing this spot.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But for me, just being able to compete at home the past few years has been extra special, in front of the home crowd and waves that I've grown up surfing. We started our season off at Honolua Bay, Maui, and Pipeline on the North Shore of Oahu. Surfing there is definitely my favorite.  </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What should anyone who goes to Hawaii eat?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Oh, you have to grab a <a href="https://banan.co/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Banan Bowl</a>. My husband and his buddies own a place for really delicious, vegan soft serve made from local bananas and local fruits, and it's just a nice, healthy treat. If you do go, you have to get a scoop of mac nut honey butter. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Surfing has a lot of its own slang. Is there a word or phrase that you particularly like?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“That was siiick.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>This interview has been lightly edited and condensed for clarity.</em></p>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
WORK LIFE
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Make It Work: The Grass Isn't Always Greener
</h1>
<img alt="Make It Work logo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Each week, our workplace whisperer Shane Loughnane answers reader-submitted questions about work in 2021. Anything you need some help with? <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ask Shane here</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Hi Shane, nothing in particular bothers me at work. Is that a thing? Or is it abnormal? It's possible that since this is my first real job I am unable to identify problem areas, but I want to be better at identifying issues and communicating them. Got any advice?—Minnie, NYC</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">While the <em>Seinfeld</em> fan in me knows that no Festivus celebration is complete without the traditional “Airing of Grievances,” the same doesn’t have to be true of every employee review. It’s quite possible to simply find yourself in a great job situation that also happens to be the right fit at the right time in your career.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">That said, you are wise to want to take advantage of the opportunity to reflect critically and provide feedback. Good managers—and I will add, far fewer than all managers—make a regular habit of collecting feedback. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I would challenge you to think about this more broadly. Rather than just focusing on problem areas, what are some things your employer could be doing to provide an even <em>better</em> work experience? Are there other areas of the business that you’d like more exposure to, or cross-training that you might benefit from? Professional development opportunities that aren’t currently being offered? Most importantly, what’s the snack situation? I hope you’re not settling for a handful of raisins.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In the meantime, don’t forget to mention to your manager the things you feel are being done particularly well. Encouraging that continued behavior is an equally important part of the feedback loop.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Btw, you are 100% right. As you progress in your career, you will inevitably get “better” at identifying issues and find yourself longing for simpler times. Until then, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UvFjDKhyz5Y" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take some advice</a> from business sage Billy Madison: “Stay here. Stay as long as you can.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>My husband loves to tell me about Irish pronunciation rules so I looked at your last name and guessed it’s pronounced “Logan.” How did I do?—Carol, Providence, RI</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Let’s see. That would make me “S. Loughnane,” which, in certain parts of Providence (Carol’s house) you might hear combined and pronounced as “Slogan”—a memorable motto or phrase <em>or</em>, historically speaking, a Scottish Highland war cry. Dang, you almost talked me into it. Unfortunately, your husband’s rules must have some exceptions. Care for another go at it, anyone? </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Coming soon...HR Brew. Be one of the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/hr/subscribe?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=crosspromo&utm_campaign=hr_in_morningbrew_081421" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first subscribers</a> to our upcoming newsletter on all things human resources.</em></p>

<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border: 2px solid #353535; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>

</table>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
The Future of Gyms Is Hybrid
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/gym-rats-bullish-inperson-workouts-trends-point-hybrid-future?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Empty gym besides one man lifting weights in front of a mirror" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjM0L2d5bS5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Mark Bertulfo/Unsplash</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s been a rough year-and-a-half for any place you go to for a half-hearted, 20-minute StairMaster sesh. Since the beginning of the pandemic, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-movie-rental-54a8021207d37650b9d96e55236553e1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">22% of US health clubs</a> have closed for good, taking 1.5 million workers with them, per the International Health Racquet & Sportsclub Association.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But for the gyms that have managed to stay open through lockdowns, business is booming.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1">
<span>Planet Fitness </span><span><a href="https://www.clubindustry.com/industry-news/planet-fitness-reports-q2-2021-revenue-1373-million-241-percent-increase?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased</a></span><span> revenue 241% last quarter compared to 2020, and added 700k new members.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1">
<span>Colin Waggett, the CEO of London-based luxury gym Third Space, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/4ca0fbd4-0f7a-408b-9b77-8e576e2b62be?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> his clubs are seeing an all-time low on cancellations for pre-booked classes (3%).</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>Xpontential, the boutique fitness company that owns brands like Club Pilates and Pure Barre, said that revenue was only 13% below Q2 2019.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">Will the good times last? </h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In May, when Covid capacity restrictions were lifting across the US, gym traffic returned to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/18/americans-back-to-gyms-interest-in-at-home-workout-wanes-jefferies.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">83%</a> of pre-pandemic levels. But crowded weight rooms may not last for long. The Delta variant has already pushed city governments in New York, San Francisco, and New Orleans to require vaccines for public venues, including gyms. And in some states, most recently <a href="https://www.koin.com/news/health/coronavirus/oregon-mask-mandate-in-effect-08132021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Oregon</a>, indoor mask mandates are coming back to make your chin even sweatier while you squat.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1">
<span>Planet Fitness CEO Chris Rondeau </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/video/2021/08/10/planet-fitness-ceo-hopes-delta-variant-is-short-lived.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a></span><span> CNBC this week that about 150 clubs currently require masks in accordance with local guidelines, but he hopes that the mandates are short-lived.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">There’s also the existential threat posed by in-home fitness companies that exploded during the pandemic. To keep up with demand for its bikes and treads, Peloton broke ground on its first US factory in Ohio this week. And even when this current wave of Covid recedes, most data points to in-home fitness sticking around and coexisting with physical gyms.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>70% of online fitness program users plan to keep using them post-pandemic, per McKinsey.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>40% of Peloton users also have a gym membership, according to the company.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Looking ahead…</strong>in many ways, the trajectory of gyms reflects the trajectory of the physical office. Advances in tech have made in-home fitness a sweaty, convenient pleasure, but others may crave human interaction and equipment they can’t find at home. </p>

#353535;\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eA few years ago I met a journalist who worked in dangerous areas of Somalia. Despite us both being in the “news” industry, I remember thinking to myself, “Well, we have \u003cem\u003every\u003c/em\u003e different jobs.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThis morning you’ll be waking up to headlines (not in Sunday Edition) of the Taliban having entered Afghanistan’s capital city of Kabul. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eMy thoughts go back to that reporter, who recently joined the Kabul bureau, and all the other journalists in the area who are bravely keeping us informed—especially the local ones for whom this must be particularly devastating.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAs one Afghan reporter wrote, “Being an Afghan journalist in Afghanistan is like writing a story about different fires in your house and report the burning of each part, despite your family members being stuck there and you can’t help them.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500\"\u003e—Neal Freyman\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE --\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd align=\"left\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nIcebreakers with...Olympic Champion Surfer Carissa Moore\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"TOKYO, JAPAN - JULY 24: Carissa Moore of Team United States poses ahead ...\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjMzL2Fyb3VuZF90aGVfZ2FtZXNfLV9vbHltcGkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eRyan Pierse/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn Tokyo, Hawaii native Carissa Moore won the gold medal for the US in surfing’s first ever Olympics. Not satisfied with that hardware, Carissa is currently competing in the World Surf League’s latest event in Oaxaca, Mexico, where she’s already notched a near-perfect 9.80 on one wave.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhat’s the world of competitive surfing like? Here’s Carissa in her own words.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow do you think surfing’s introduction to the Olympics will affect the sport?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI hope it opens up surfing to a broader audience and can bring more people in, whether that's by inspiring someone to try surfing for the first time, or motivating them to choose their own path.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAs an athlete who’s been vocal about your mental health, how have you felt seeing Naomi Osaka and Simone Biles put a spotlight on mental health this year?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI think we all, every human, go through our own mental struggles. I feel that as athletes, sometimes it can be amplified with the pressure of the events and being under a microscope. But being conscious of and in tune with your own mental health, not being afraid to ask for help, and taking the time you need to feel through that space is super important.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is the community of pro surfer women like?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIt’s a really small, tight community. I feel like everybody knows everybody for the most part, and it’s like a second family to me. I've grown up with a lot of the women on tour, and there’s mutual respect among all of us. But also we want to beat each other really bad, you know?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIf you could compete at any surf spot in the world, where would it be?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOaxaca is definitely one of the places that I'm the most excited to compete at. I’ve been on a surf trip here but it was over 10 years ago, and I have some of the best memories from surfing this spot.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBut for me, just being able to compete at home the past few years has been extra special, in front of the home crowd and waves that I've grown up surfing. We started our season off at Honolua Bay, Maui, and Pipeline on the North Shore of Oahu. Surfing there is definitely my favorite.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat should anyone who goes to Hawaii eat?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOh, you have to grab a \u003ca href=\"https://banan.co/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBanan Bowl\u003c/a\u003e. My husband and his buddies own a place for really delicious, vegan soft serve made from local bananas and local fruits, and it's just a nice, healthy treat. If you do go, you have to get a scoop of mac nut honey butter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSurfing has a lot of its own slang. Is there a word or phrase that you particularly like?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“That was siiick.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis interview has been lightly edited and condensed for clarity.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F13%2Ficebreakers-witholympic-champion-surfer-carissa-moore\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEach week, our workplace whisperer Shane Loughnane answers reader-submitted questions about work in 2021. Anything you need some help with? \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAsk Shane here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHi Shane, nothing in particular bothers me at work. Is that a thing? Or is it abnormal? It's possible that since this is my first real job I am unable to identify problem areas, but I want to be better at identifying issues and communicating them. Got any advice?—Minnie, NYC\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhile the \u003cem\u003eSeinfeld\u003c/em\u003e fan in me knows that no Festivus celebration is complete without the traditional “Airing of Grievances,” the same doesn’t have to be true of every employee review. It’s quite possible to simply find yourself in a great job situation that also happens to be the right fit at the right time in your career.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThat said, you are wise to want to take advantage of the opportunity to reflect critically and provide feedback. Good managers—and I will add, far fewer than all managers—make a regular habit of collecting feedback. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI would challenge you to think about this more broadly. Rather than just focusing on problem areas, what are some things your employer could be doing to provide an even \u003cem\u003ebetter\u003c/em\u003e work experience? Are there other areas of the business that you’d like more exposure to, or cross-training that you might benefit from? Professional development opportunities that aren’t currently being offered? Most importantly, what’s the snack situation? I hope you’re not settling for a handful of raisins.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn the meantime, don’t forget to mention to your manager the things you feel are being done particularly well. Encouraging that continued behavior is an equally important part of the feedback loop.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBtw, you are 100% right. As you progress in your career, you will inevitably get “better” at identifying issues and find yourself longing for simpler times. Until then, \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UvFjDKhyz5Y\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake some advice\u003c/a\u003e from business sage Billy Madison: “Stay here. Stay as long as you can.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMy husband loves to tell me about Irish pronunciation rules so I looked at your last name and guessed it’s pronounced “Logan.” How did I do?—Carol, Providence, RI\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eLet’s see. That would make me “S. Loughnane,” which, in certain parts of Providence (Carol’s house) you might hear combined and pronounced as “Slogan”—a memorable motto or phrase \u003cem\u003eor\u003c/em\u003e, historically speaking, a Scottish Highland war cry. Dang, you almost talked me into it. Unfortunately, your husband’s rules must have some exceptions. Care for another go at it, anyone? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eComing soon...HR Brew. padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nThe Future of Gyms Is Hybrid\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/gym-rats-bullish-inperson-workouts-trends-point-hybrid-future?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Empty gym besides one man lifting weights in front of a mirror\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjM0L2d5bS5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eMark Bertulfo/Unsplash\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIt’s been a rough year-and-a-half for any place you go to for a half-hearted, 20-minute StairMaster sesh. Since the beginning of the pandemic, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-movie-rental-54a8021207d37650b9d96e55236553e1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e22% of US health clubs\u003c/a\u003e have closed for good, taking 1.5 million workers with them, per the International Health Racquet \u0026 Sportsclub Association.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBut for the gyms that have managed to stay open through lockdowns, business is booming.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlanet Fitness \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.clubindustry.com/industry-news/planet-fitness-reports-q2-2021-revenue-1373-million-241-percent-increase?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e revenue 241% last quarter compared to 2020, and added 700k new members.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eColin Waggett, the CEO of London-based luxury gym Third Space, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/4ca0fbd4-0f7a-408b-9b77-8e576e2b62be?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e his clubs are seeing an all-time low on cancellations for pre-booked classes (3%).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eXpontential, the boutique fitness company that owns brands like Club Pilates and Pure Barre, said that revenue was only 13% below Q2 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eWill the good times last? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn May, when Covid capacity restrictions were lifting across the US, gym traffic returned to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/18/americans-back-to-gyms-interest-in-at-home-workout-wanes-jefferies.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e83%\u003c/a\u003e of pre-pandemic levels. But crowded weight rooms may not last for long. The Delta variant has already pushed city governments in New York, San Francisco, and New Orleans to require vaccines for public venues, including gyms. And in some states, most recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.koin.com/news/health/coronavirus/oregon-mask-mandate-in-effect-08132021/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOregon\u003c/a\u003e, indoor mask mandates are coming back to make your chin even sweatier while you squat.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlanet Fitness CEO Chris Rondeau \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/video/2021/08/10/planet-fitness-ceo-hopes-delta-variant-is-short-lived.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e CNBC this week that about 150 clubs currently require masks in accordance with local guidelines, but he hopes that the mandates are short-lived.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThere’s also the existential threat posed by in-home fitness companies that exploded during the pandemic. To keep up with demand for its bikes and treads, Peloton broke ground on its first US factory in Ohio this week. And even when this current wave of Covid recedes, most data points to in-home fitness sticking around and coexisting with physical gyms.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e70% of online fitness program users plan to keep using them post-pandemic, per McKinsey.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e40% of Peloton users also have a gym membership, according to the company.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ein many ways, the trajectory of gyms reflects the trajectory of the physical office. Advances in tech have made in-home fitness a sweaty, convenient pleasure, but others may crave human interaction and equipment they can’t find at home. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F13%2Fgym-rats-bullish-inperson-workouts-trends-point-hybrid-future\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
